author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Government Railway Police on Sunday arrested 16 youth on charges of damaging railway property at the Pazhavanthangal railway station .

A police official said the 16 youngsters went on a rampage of breaking 22 tube lights and a fan on the night of January 1. Based on a complaint filed by the staff at the railway station, a case was filed.

Except a 20-year-old, the rest of the youth are aged between 12 and 16. They are residents of Kannan Colony in Pazhavanthangal.

A case under Section 151 of the Indian Railway Act (damaging railway property) has been registered.
title: 16 held for damaging railway property
